answers.author: Timothy Wolff
answers.text:
We are roughly 50% LED and 50% Fluorescent presently.  All track lighting, can lighting, exterior were converted in 2011.  We plan to do the remaining fluorescent fixtures this autumn.

author: Sarah Hazel
text: We (The Town of Chapel Hill) have recently completed a multi-phased lighting project in our Council Chambers, installing LEDs to replace ALL other lighting types in the room: Fresnel studio lighting, fluorescent T-8 lighting, recessed incandescent lighting, and various types of decorative/accent lighting are all LEDs now. We’ve found other case studies of municipalities where some LEDs were installed in a main public meeting space but have yet to find a 100 percent LED retrofit. Does anyone else claim to be the first “LED Chamber” in the nation? If there are others, can you share your experience?
title: LED Council Chamber!
